title: navy ships typeface
content:
Hey people,

I'm looking for the typeface, or a similar one, that is used on navy ships. I think most countries use a similar typeface on their vessels. They usually are angular letters (like Gridnik for example). If anyone has any tips, let me know! :)

Thanks.
author: Quincunx

comments.content:
I'm looking for the applicable Navy or MIL standard, but no luck so far. In the meantime:

[http://www.tlai.com/med\_des/modeling.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235928/http:/www.tlai.com/med_des/modeling.html "http://www.tlai.com/med\_des/modeling.html")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/36593](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235928/http:/typophile.com/node/36593 "http://typophile.com/node/36593")

This isn't likely to be much practical help -- it's unlikely to specify any fonts by name -- but the applicable standard is [ASTM F906](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235928/http:/www.astm.org/Standards/F906.htm). I haven't found an online copy.
These are already a big help. :)
